intro: Lepidocoma gracilis, commonly known as the slender lepidocoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the spring. Native to the temperate regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its overall graceful appearance. Lepidocoma gracilis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
